official-title.#text:
To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of
		  1965 to provide grants to States to establish a comprehensive school counseling
		  program.

text.#text: The term

quote.#tail:
means a framework that encompasses grades 6 through 12 and
				postsecondary education and that includes information on career awareness,
				skills assessment, skills training, student interest surveys, postsecondary
				education entrance requirements, secondary school graduation requirements, high
				school equivalency, adult education programs and services, financial aid,
				institutions of higher education, community colleges, programs leading to
				industry-recognized credentials, career and technical education programs,
				internships, dual enrollment programs, apprenticeships, and professional
				development opportunities for school counselors.

text.#text:
From amounts appropriated to carry out this part and
				not reserved by the

Each
				establishment grant under this subsection shall be for a period of not more
				than 2 years.

Each
				grant shall be of an amount not less than $2,000,000 and not more than
				$5,000,000.

is
				achieving the intended outcomes of the grant;

shows continued
				engagement with stakeholders; and

has established
				a statewide counseling framework.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall reserve not less than 10 percent and
				not more than 20 percent of the amounts appropriated to carry out this part for
				any fiscal year to award capacity-building grants, on a competitive basis, to
				State educational agencies that do not receive an establishment grant under
for such year.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2502/ss:a

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5703

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines is an acceptable use of funds.

text.#text:
A
				State educational agency that receives a capacity-building grant under this
				subsection shall use grant funds to carry out 1 or more of the activities from
				the State educational agency’s application under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may require. The application shall
				include—

text.#text:
A State educational agency desiring a grant
				under this part shall submit an application at such time, in such manner, and
				containing such information as the

a description of a
				proposed statewide counseling framework that is developed in consultation with
				not less than 5 stakeholders, of which at least 1 stakeholder shall be a local
				business or industry or statewide industry organization and 1 stakeholder shall
				be a local educational agency or secondary school;

a detailed plan to implement a
				statewide counseling framework that is developed in consultation with not less
				than 5 stakeholders, of which at least 1 stakeholder shall be a local business
				or industry or statewide industry organization and 1 shall be a local
				educational agency or secondary school; or

evidence of an existing statewide
				counseling framework and implementation plan supported by not less than 5
				stakeholders, of which at least 1 stakeholder shall be a local business or
				industry or statewide industry organization and 1 shall be a local educational
				agency or secondary school; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: are carried out.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5704

text.#text:
a description of
				how the State educational agency will award subgrants and ensure that the
				activities described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall use grant funds to—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5702/ss:a

text.#text:
A State educational agency receiving an establishment
				grant under

develop and
				implement comprehensive school counseling programs that align with the
				statewide counseling framework proposed or described in the State educational
				agency’s application;

hire additional
				school counselors to effectively serve more students in postsecondary education
				and adult education planning and career guidance activities, where
				applicable;

identify regional
				workforce trends in collaboration with entities at the State and regional level
				with expertise in identifying such trends, such as State workforce investment
				boards, local workforce investment boards, regional economic development
				organizations, or State employment agencies;

train school
				counselors effectively to provide students with current and relevant workforce
				information, financial aid assistance, personal counseling, and academic
				advising relevant to students’ individual career and postsecondary education
				goals;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5704/ss:a/p:4

text.#text:
develop and
				implement a process and infrastructure for school counselors and school
				counselor programs to access the statewide counseling framework and information
				regarding the regional workforce trends identified in

develop a
				searchable method by which counseling professional development opportunities
				from around the State are collected, maintained, and disseminated to school
				counselors;

establish,
				improve, or coordinate postsecondary opportunities, which may include
				individual career planning, personalized learning plans, registered
				apprenticeships, internships, dual enrollment programs, programs leading to
				industry-recognized credentials (including programs at a secondary school),
				2-year degree programs, 4-year degree programs, and other applicable
				postsecondary opportunities;

provide
				recommendations and improve a local educational agency’s and other education
				service program providers to out of school youth and adults curricula to better
				align with workforce trends and available postsecondary opportunities;

conduct other
				activities pertaining to the administration of the statewide framework;

establish
				partnerships with American Job Centers, which may include co-locating an
				American Job Center in a high school, transporting students to local American
				Job Centers, or having American Job Center career counselors and business
				liaisons assist school counselors in hosting job fairs, career days, or other
				such similar tasks; and

leverage
				resources and emerging technologies that are being developed by stakeholders to
				support the counseling framework.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
directly or
				through awarding subgrants, on a competitive basis, to eligible entities to
				enable the eligible entities to carry out any of the activities.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5704/ss:a

text.#text:
A State educational agency that receives an establishment
				grant may carry out the activities described in

An
				eligible entity that desires a subgrant under this subsection shall submit an
				application to the State educational agency at such time, in such manner, and
				containing such information as the State educational agency may reasonably
				require, including a description of the comprehensive school counseling program
				for participating schools and students that the eligible entity proposes to
				develop and implement using subgrant funds.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may use grant funds to hire additional school personnel
				to carry out the activities described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5702/ss:a
Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:5704/ss:a

text.#text:
An eligible entity that receives an establishment grant
				under

Funds made available
				under this part shall be used to supplement, and not supplant, other Federal,
				State, and local funds available to carry out the activities supported under
				this part.

, and
				every 3 years thereafter, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Counseling for Career Choice Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall prepare and submit to the
				appropriate committees of

a report on the progress made by the
				eligible entities receiving grants under this part in implementing grant
				activities.

text.#text:
Not later than 3
				years after the date of enactment of the

$40,000,000 for each of the 4 succeeding fiscal
